Name: Standing Statue of Tuthmosis the Third
Description: This finely carved statuette portrays Tuthmosis the Third standing and wearing a short kilt and the White Crown of Upper Egypt. The crown is inlaid with gold-plated copper. This statue is formed of many parts. Each part was carved separately and then assembled to complete the statue. The king originally held a scepter and a staff; these are now missing. The statuette rests on a wooden base inlaid with a vertical column of hieroglyphs that reads, "King of Upper and Lower Egypt, Menkheperre, the son of Re, Tuthmosis."
